meanings.definition: A shrub or small tree of the rose family, typically bearing white flowers in early spring.
meanings.sent1: The shadbush bloomed beautifully in the garden.
meanings.sent2: I saw a lovely shadbush while walking in the park.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel hid nuts behind the shadbush.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as pure and delicate as a shadbush in full bloom.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the shadbush filled the air with sweetness.

meanings.definition: The fruit of the shadbush, resembling a small apple.
meanings.sent1: I picked a ripe shadbush and took a bite.
meanings.sent2: The birds feasted on the juicy shadbushes in the tree.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to juggle the shadbushes.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks were as rosy as a shadbush fruit.
meanings.sent5: The flavor of the shadbush exploded in my mouth like a burst of happiness.
